params.text:
• Introducing Yourself
  • Ask to talk to someone
  • Give the subject of your call

Telephone

Make a Short Call

Language in Action
Telephone: Introduction
Today, you will learn how to make simple phone calls.

1. Introducing Yourself : Learn how to say who you are when you answer the phone.

  2. Ask to talk to someone: Practice asking to speak with a specific person.

  3. Give the subject of your call: Learn how to explain briefly why you are calling.
Introducing Yourself: Flashcards

dialogs.answer:
Use this to say your name.
Example: My name is John.

Another way to say your name.
Example: Hello, I'm Maria.

Ask this to know the other person's name.
Example: Who are you?

Another way to ask for someone's name.
Example: What is your name?

Say this when you meet someone new.
Example: Nice to meet you, Peter.

Ask this to be polite.
Example: How are you?

params.text: Please flip through the flashcards to see useful phrases and explanation:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: How does Bryan introduce himself to Abigail?
answers:
He says his name.

He asks her name.

He asks how she is.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Abigail say when she meets Bryan?
answers:
She says hello and her name.

She says goodbye.

She asks for Bryan's phone number.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What do Bryan and Abigail say to each other at the end of the conversation?
answers:
They say goodbye.

They ask for each other's phone numbers.

They start talking about the weather.

params.text: Introducing Yourself: Listening & Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Bryan: Hello. My name is Bryan.

Abigail: Hello, Bryan. I’m Abigail. Nice to meet you.

Bryan: Nice to meet you too, Abigail.

Abigail: Where do you work?

Bryan: I’m with the sales department.

Abigail: Oh, me too!

Bryan: Really? What is your name again?

Abigail: Abigail.

Bryan: Nice to meet you, Abigail.
Dialogue Text:
Bryan:
Abigail:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Introducing Yourself
answers:
He says his own name and greets Micah.

He asks for Micah's name.

He asks where Micah works.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Micah say after Anthony introduces himself?
answers:
She introduces himself.

She says goodbye.

She asks for Anthony's phone number.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What do Anthony and Micah discover about each other at the end of the conversation?
answers:
They work for the same company.

They are from the same city.

They know each other's friends.

params.text:
Anthony: Hello, my name is Anthony. Nice to meet you.

Micah: Hello, Anthony. I'm Micah. Nice to meet you too.

Anthony: What is your name again?

Micah: Micah.

Anthony: Nice to meet you, Micah. Who are you?

Micah: I work for Green Company.

Anthony: Oh, me too!
Dialogue Text:
Micah:
Anthony:
Introducing Yourself: Listening & Quiz
Ask To Talk To Someone: Flashcards

dialogs.answer:
Use this to ask for someone.
Example: Can I speak to John, please?

Another way to ask for someone.
Example: I'd like to speak to the manager, please.

Ask if someone is available.
Example: Is Mr. Smith there?

A polite way to ask for someone.
Example: Could I speak to the reception, please?

A direct way to ask for someone.
Example: I want to talk to the sales department.

Ask the operator to connect you.
Example: Put me through to customer service, please.

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Who does Anthony want to talk to?
Question 2 of 3: Why can’t Anthony speak to Mr. Johnson?
answers:
Mr. Johnson is busy.

Mr. Johnson is not in the office.

Mr. Johnson doesn’t want to talk to Anthony.

metadata.title: Ask To Talk To Someone Conversation Quiz

params.text: Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Receptionist:  Hello, this is Hartford Trading. How can I help you?

Anthony: Hello, I’d like to speak to Mr. Johnson, please.

Receptionist: One moment, please. I’ll check if he’s available.

Receptionist: I’m sorry, Mr. Johnson is not available at the moment. He’s in a meeting. Would you like to leave a message or call back later?

Anthony: Can I call back later?

Receptionist: Yes, of course. He should be free in about an hour.
Dialogue Text:
Anthony:
Receptionist:

metadata.title: Ask To Talk To Someone Drag the Words

params.text: Give The Subject Of Your Call: Flashcards

dialogs.answer:
Use this to say what you want to do.
Example: I would like to book a hotel.

Use this to say what you need to do.
Example: I need to cancel my order.

Use this to say what you want.
Example: I would like information about the job.

Use this to talk about the reason for your call.
Example: It's about my appointment.

Another way to say the reason for your call.
Example: I'm calling about the bill.

Use this when you want to ask something.
Example: I have a question about the delivery.

metadata.title: Give The Subject Of Your Call Conversation Quiz

params.text: Module Summary Quiz
Choose the BEST answer for each question:

choices.question: Question 1 of 6: How do you introduce yourself on the phone?
answers:
Say your name.

Ask the other person's name.

Ask for their phone number.

choices.question: Question 2 of 6: Which phrase can you use to ask to speak to someone?
answers:
Can I speak to Mr. Smith?

I want to eat pizza.

How are you?

choices.question: Question 3 of 6: What can you say to explain why you are calling?
answers:
I would like to book a hotel.

I like your shoes.

Who are you?

choices.question: Question 4 of 6: Which phrase is used to ask for someone's name?
answers:
What is your name?

I need to go now.

Can I help you?

choices.question: Question 5 of 6: How do you say goodbye on the phone?
Question 6 of 6: Which phrase can you use to ask if someone is available?
answers:
Is Mr. Brown there?

I want a pizza.

Nice to meet you.
